topLevelComment.author: Caio Amaral Corrêa
topLevelComment.text: May I suggest visual studio code with quokka.js instead of code pen

replies.author: freeCodeCamp.org
replies.text: I just installed vscode and quokka.js.  The next video I'll use those; I think quokka might make it easier to understand how the code is running.  Thanks for the suggestion!

topLevelComment.author: cruz
topLevelComment.text: So it says easy but I honestly don't know what happened here, what should I learn before watching this series?

replies.author: freeCodeCamp.org
replies.text: I guess I should ask which part you got lost at?  There are always two main parts to problem solving in programming.  Solving it on paper and implementing it in code.  If you are able to simulate this problem on paper, implementing it shouldn't be too difficult.  If it is difficult to implement, it will just require more practice solving and implementing problems over time.

topLevelComment.author: Breakpoint
topLevelComment.text: out of curiosity, where is this even used in real life?

replies.author: DeadInside
replies.text: I don't know if it's considered real life (lol) but tag systems are used to prove the Turing-universality of the rule 110 cellular automaton

replies.author: Breakpoint
replies.text: ok that is what I thought :) I couldn't see where this would be useful in real life, but a good mental exercise

replies.author: freeCodeCamp.org
replies.text: I'd say these practice problems are more for improving your problem solving skills which are of course used daily when programming.
